element.name: Lion's Head by toczygroszek, Unknown Cache (3/4.5)

description.p: This is a puzzle-multi-tidal cache. You have to solve the puzzle, find the container with coordinates of the final cache and check tides before you reach the final location.

element.long-description:
Lion's Head - beautiful and scenic spot on Howth, really worth visiting. So remember to bring a camera with you.
Before you come there, check tides, as the final cache is accessible only at low tide. You can check tides HERE.
Coordinates are for start point only. From there go down following an overgrown path. This path is really overgrown and may be hard to locate, so the best way is do this cache at winter time. So, just go down to the 1st stage. And the 1st stage is hidden at coordinates:
You can check your answers for this puzzle on
Geochecker.com.
At stage 1 you will find coordinates of the final cache. Way to the cache is the most dangerous part of this cache. Rocky cliffs, slippery steps, splashes of waves, tiny path on steep slope, so remember all you do it's at your own risk, and whatever you do just TAKE your TIME!
You need proper boots (slippery steep path and rocks) and long trousers (thorny brambles).
Oh, have I mentioned the restroom in attributes for this cache? Feel free to use this one
element.additional-waypoints:
FL1WREN - The Cache
N/S __ ° __ . ___ W/E ___ ° __ . ___
S11WREN - Stage1
N/S __ ° __ . ___ W/E ___ ° __ . ___
element.encoded-hints: Please, don't waste your time sending me questions about more hints. Stage 1: stone Final: stone

ul.li:
2010-06-16T19:00:00Z : Found it by Crannyn
Finally we got it on a beautiful sunny evening. TFTC

2010-04-11T19:00:00Z : Found it by Fjon
Encouraged by the recent finds I decided to give this another go today. It was a glorious sunny day and the place was very busy. This time I firstly went searching for the funky toilet which I couldn't find last time. Having found it, I quickly found the cache too, only a few meters from where we were looking last time. Great cache, and not one I'll forget in a hurry!

2010-04-09T19:00:00Z : Found it by Fitzet
After the difficulty of locating Stage 1 and the last 2 DNFs, I wasn't confident about locating this one.
After 15 minutes of searching high and low, and almost 'braining' hollmanr with a loose rock, I was ready to give in to my low expectations. However, hollmanr wasn't ready to walk away empty-handed and was rewarded for his perseverance. The form of the cache was not what I expected - I was assuming that it would be the same as Stage 1.
TNLN SL TFTC

2010-04-09T19:00:00Z : Found it by hollmanr
Oh Yes ! Found it together with Fitzet on a nice evening. After having done the 1st stage back in October we left this one for after the winter. With spring in the air today it was the perfect moment. We were not that confident after seeing a couple of DNF recently but determination got us there in the end. Apologies for leaving some blood stains on the rocks nearby after cutting my finger on one of the rocks. They should be gone in the next few days :-) Extra bonus was finding the toilet as shown in the picture gallery ! Took travel bug, left nothing. TFTC !

2010-02-21T20:00:00Z : Didn't find it by Jumpin Jiminie
Great fun climbing up and down but unfortunately no cache to be had :o(
This time!!!

wpt.name: GC1WREN
wpt.desc: Lion's Head by toczygroszek, Unknown Cache (3/4.5)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Lion's Head
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:short_description: This is a puzzle-multi-tidal cache. You have to solve the puzzle, find the container with coordinates of the final cache and check tides before you reach the final location.
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
Lion's Head - beautiful and scenic spot on Howth, really worth visiting. So remember to bring a camera with you.

Before you come there, check tides, as the final cache is accessible only at low tide. You can check tides HERE.

Coordinates are for start point only. From there go down following an overgrown path. This path is really overgrown and may be hard to locate, so the best way is do this cache at winter time. So, just go down to the 1st stage. And the 1st stage is hidden at coordinates:

You can check your answers for this puzzle on Geochecker.com.


At stage 1 you will find coordinates of the final cache. Way to the cache is the most dangerous part of this cache. Rocky cliffs, slippery steps, splashes of waves, tiny path on steep slope, so remember all you do it's at your own risk, and whatever you do just TAKE your TIME!

You need proper boots (slippery steep path and rocks) and long trousers (thorny brambles).

Oh, have I mentioned the restroom in attributes for this cache? Feel free to use this one

groundspeak:log.groundspeak:text: Finally we got it on a beautiful sunny evening. TFTC

Encouraged by the recent finds I decided to give this another go today. It was a glorious sunny day and the place was very busy. This time I firstly went searching for the funky toilet which I couldn't find last time. Having found it, I quickly found the cache too, only a few meters from where we were looking last time. Great cache, and not one I'll forget in a hurry!

After the difficulty of locating Stage 1 and the last 2 DNFs, I wasn't confident about locating this one.
After 15 minutes of searching high and low, and almost 'braining' hollmanr with a loose rock, I was ready to give in to my low expectations. However, hollmanr wasn't ready to walk away empty-handed and was rewarded for his perseverance. The form of the cache was not what I expected - I was assuming that it would be the same as Stage 1.
TNLN SL TFTC

Oh Yes ! Found it together with Fitzet on a nice evening. After having done the 1st stage back in October we left this one for after the winter. With spring in the air today it was the perfect moment. We were not that confident after seeing a couple of DNF recently but determination got us there in the end. Apologies for leaving some blood stains on the rocks nearby after cutting my finger on one of the rocks. They should be gone in the next few days :-) Extra bonus was finding the toilet as shown in the picture gallery ! Took travel bug, left nothing. TFTC !

Great fun climbing up and down but unfortunately no cache to be had :o(
This time!!!
